title: Reliable Alternative Energy Sources
cleaned_text: Reliable Alternative Energy Sources Current law defines recycled energy for purposes of the renewable energy standard as energy produced by a generation unit with a nameplate capacity of not more than 15 megawatts. For pumped hydroelectricity generation only, section 2 specifies that the energy be produced by a generation unit with a nameplate capacity of not more than 400 megawatts. (Note: This summary applies to this bill as introduced.)
